comments:
I apologize if the sequence of steps seem a bit long, but it's the shortest 
sequence that I could find (in a reasonable amount of time) that still caused 
this error to occur.

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Start Eclipse from a new workspace.
2. File -> Import -> Log File
3. Add the access.log and error.log files from the examples (the Apache Http 
server logs) to the default log set. Click Finish to import these log files.
4. In the Log Navigator view, right click on Correlations -> New -> Log 
Correlation. Select Log Correlation in the resulting wizard, and click next.
5. Select the two logs from the "Available Logs" table and move them over to 
the "Selected Logs" table. Click Next.
6. Select Default Time as the correlation schema, and click Finish.
7. In the Log Navigator view, right click on the new correlation -> Open With -
> Log Interractions.
8. Right click on an empty area in the Log Interractions view -> Filter Log 
Record.
9. Add a new filter: "severity", "=", "50". Click OK.
10. Right click on an empty area in the Log Interractions view -> Filter Log 
Record.
11. Click on the Restore Defaults button. Click OK.
12. Click on the first log record in the server access log in the Log 
Interractions view to highlight it. Right click on that record -> Open in Log 
View.
13. In the Log Navigator view, expand "NewCorrelations" to show the two log 
record entries in its children. Click on the access.log child 
under "NewCorrelation".

After doing all of that, I get an error message on the screen. It looks (more 
or less) like this:

----------------------------------------------------------
Error
An error has occurred. See error log for more details.
----------------------------------------------------------
